vague_description: A printing company needs to decide on the number of math and English workbooks to produce given constraints on minimum and maximum quantities, while aiming to maximize profit.
detailed_description: A printing company sells math workbooks and English workbooks. To meet demand, they must make at least \param{MinMath} math workbooks and at least \param{MinEnglish} English workbooks. However, they can make at most \param{MaxMath} math workbooks and at most \param{MaxEnglish} English workbooks. The company has a contract with a school to send at least \param{MinTotalWorkbooks} workbooks of either type. If the profit per math workbook is $\param{ProfitMath} and the profit per English workbook is $\param{ProfitEnglish}, how many of each should the company make to maximize profit?
target_objective: Maximize the company's profit from workbook production
target_constraints: Number of math workbooks is at least MinMath
Number of math workbooks is at most MaxMath
Number of English workbooks is at least MinEnglish
Number of English workbooks is at most MaxEnglish
Total number of workbooks is at least MinTotalWorkbooks
target_parameters: Minimum number of math workbooks to be made
Minimum number of English workbooks to be made
Maximum number of math workbooks to be made
Maximum number of English workbooks to be made
Minimum total number of workbooks to be sent under the contract
